caption.p: Relative abundance of the common genera in the human oropharynx. Comparison of the abundance of each phylum in individuals between the ILI/S flu + group (+) and the asymptomatic controls (-). Genera are indicated in each panel. Error bars represent the standard deviation. A non-parametric Kruskal-Wallis test for multiple comparisons was applied to identify the statistically significant differences in relative abundances between groups. * P < .05. Samples are from individuals prior to their entry to quarantine (baseline) and at days 3, 6, and 28 after the challenge, or not (in the control group). Abbreviations: dpi, days postâ€“influenza challenge; ILI/S flu+, subjects who received viral challenge, had laboratory evidence of influenza, and had an influenza-like illness/were symptomatic.
